com.bigdata

Class Banner

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bigdata.Banner

  • public class Banner
extends Object
    Class has a static method which writes a copyright banner on stdout once per JVM. This method is invoked from several core classes in order to ensure that the copyright banner is always written out on bigdata startup.
    Author:
    Bryan Thompson

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description

      An interface which declares the keys for the map returned by getBuildInfo() .
      static interface  Banner.Options
      Environment variables understood by the Banner class.

      • getBuildInfo

        public static Map<String,String> getBuildInfo()
        Method used to discover and report on the bigdata build information. A com.bigdata.BuildInfo class is built when the JAR is created. However, it may not be present when running under an IDE from the source code and, therefore, there MUST NOT be any compile time references to the com.bigdata.BuildInfo class. This method uses reflection to avoid a compile time dependency.

        Note: This method works fine. However, people running from an IDE will observe stale data from old com.bigdata.BuildInfo class files left from a previous build of a JAR. This makes the information good for deployed versions of the JAR but potentially misleading when people are running under an IDE.

        Returns:
        Build info metadata iff available.
        See Also:
        Banner.BuildInfoMeta

      • getStaticVariables

        public static Map<String,String> getStaticVariables(String className)
        Utility class to get the static string variables for a given class name.

        Returns:

      • getVersion

        public static final String getVersion()
        Attempts to return the build version (aka the release version) from the com.bigdata.BuildInfo class. This class is generated by build.xml and is NOT available from the IDE. It is correct discovered using reflection.
        Returns:
        Build version if available and null otherwise.
        See Also:
        getBuildInfo()

      • getBanner

        public static String getBanner()
        Return the banner.

        Outputs the banner and exits.
